sign.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a piece of paper, metal, or wood with words or a picture that gives people information, warnings, or instructions
sign.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Don’t ignore the fog warning signs.
sign.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: an event, fact etc that shows that something is happening or that something is true or exists
sign.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: A paw print in the dust was a sign that a tiger was close.
There are signs that the situation is improving.
There were no signs of forced entry into the house.
A red morning sky is a sign of an impending storm.
Crying is seen as a sign of weakness.
sign.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a movement, sound etc that you make in order to tell someone something
sign.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: the thumbs-up sign  (=a sign that you make with your hand to show that something is successful)
Wait until I give the sign.
Bruce made a sign that he was ready to leave.
Three short blasts on the whistle was the sign to begin.
sign.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a mark or shape that has a particular meaning
sign.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a group of stars, representing one of 12 parts of the year, that some people believe influences your behaviour and your life
sign.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: a language that uses hand movements instead of spoken words, used by people who cannot hear
sign.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 2: an event, fact etc that shows that something is happening or that something is true or exists
sign.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: There are clear signs of a slowdown in economic growth.
He was walking up and down, a sure sign that he was worried.
If she can move her legs, that’s a good sign.
The jury was taking ages to make up its mind, which he felt was probably a bad sign.
Kim received the news without showing any visible sign of emotion.
In this case, social workers missed the warning signs and failed to protect the children.
She would not look at me directly, a tell-tale sign that she was embarrassed.
They ran off at the first sign of trouble.
There are now signs of an improvement in the economy.
It had all the signs of a crime of passion.
Did she show any signs of distress?
The bed was neatly made and bore no signs of having been slept in.
I could see some signs of improvement in her health.
sign.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: sign
an event, fact etc that shows that something is happening or that something is true or exists
The curtains were still drawn and there was no sign of activity.
A score of 80 or more is a sign that you are doing very well.
indication
a sign. Indication is more formal than sign
Recently there have been several indications of improving relations.
There was no indication the killings were related to the drug trade.
evidence
facts or signs that show clearly that something exists or is true, especially something that you are trying to prove
Scientists are hoping to find evidence that there was once life on Mars.
There was not enough evidence to convict him of the murder.
symptom
a sign that someone has an illness or that a serious problem exists
The first symptoms are tiredness and loss of weight.
Is this a symptom of the decay of Western civilization?
indicator
a sign that shows you what is happening or what is true – used about a process, or about the state or level of something
There are a number of indicators of economic slowdown.
The tests are considered a good indicator of intelligence.
signal
a sign that shows that you should do something, or that you have a particular attitude
Severe chest pain is a warning signal that cannot be ignored.
Legalizing drugs could send the wrong signal to young people.
a sign, especially that you respect or honour someone
People stood in silence as a mark of respect.
It was a mark of her popularity that so many colleagues and friends attended the presentation.
sign.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to write your signature on something to show that you wrote it, agree with it, or were present
sign.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The artist had signed his name in the corner of the painting.
You forgot to sign the cheque.
Over a hundred people have signed the petition.
Serena signs her autograph every time she’s asked.
a signed photo of Paul McCartney
sign.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: if a football team or music company signs someone, or if someone signs for them, that person signs a contract in which they agree to work for them
sign.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: CBS Records had signed her back in 1988 on a three-album contract.
Miller worked in the shipyards before signing for Rangers.
Before long, they had signed with Virgin.
sign.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to try to tell someone something or ask them to do something by using signs and movements
sign.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: He signed to the maid to leave the room.
sign to somebody to do something
She signed for us to go inside.
sign for somebody to do something
sign.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: to use, or translate something into, sign language
sign.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to write your SIGNATURE on a letter, document, or CHEQUE
sign.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: The customer must sign the traveller’s cheque in front of the cashier.
sign.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: to show formally that you agree to do something, by signing a legal document
sign.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: In September, the company signed a contract to produce two million doses of the vaccine.
sign.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: with all the necessary legal documents agreed and signed
sign.translation[2].definitions[2].examp: The agreement is not signed and sealed yet.
sign.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: a piece of paper, metal etc in a public place, with words or drawings on it that give people information, warn them not to do something etc
sign.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: a picture, shape etc that has a particular meaning
sign.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: For some reason the computer can’t display the dollar sign.
